intro: Achras calcicola, commonly known as the limestone achenes, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, commonly known as the palm family, and is characterized by its unique morphological features. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils, showcasing its adaptation to arid and nutrient-poor environments. Its structure includes a slender trunk and pinnate leaves, which contribute to its distinct appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Achras calcicola is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
